page.title: 07THE OLD HALL, HECKMONDWIKE
page.content: {PUBLIC HOUSE: Although born at Fieldhead, Birstall, on 13th March, 1733, Joseph Priestley, philosopher, scientist, and discoverer of oxygen, spent his childhood years (from 1742 to 1752) living with his aunt Sarah Keighley at Heckmondwike Old Hall. He attended Batley Grammar School learning Latin and Greek. Today the Old Hall is converted into a distinctive public house. It was restored by Malcolm Lister in 1982 into the finest example of a half timbered building in England. The present entrance hall was once a priest's confessional. The main bar retains its original ceiling and many of the oak beams date back to 1740. Which is the most vivid memory of my visit? - the licensee playing "Love's Cigarette" - a 1920's tune on the pianola. { FRANCIS GILLARD
